snippet: To end its gridlock, Washington should recall the argument of a Nobel laureate in economics: that the key to successful negotiation is the ability to commit to future action.
abstract: Richard H Thaler Economic View column contends that Washington, to end its gridlock, should recall the argument of Nobel laureate in economics Thomas Schelling: that the key to successful negotiation is the ability to commit to future action course of; holds Schelling's teachings suggest that both the Senate and Pres Obama could negotiate to avoid escalation of retaliation.
lead_paragraph: To end its gridlock, Washington should recall the argument of a Nobel laureate in economics: that the key to successful negotiation is the ability to commit to future action.
